snippet: Architecture for Humanity, a nonprofit design group specializing in socially conscious construction, has abruptly closed its San Francisco headquarters and plans to file for bankruptcy protection.
abstract: Architecture for Humanity, nonprofit design group that pursued socially conscious construction in places damaged by war or natural disaster, shuts down after declaring plans to file bankruptcy; reasons for financial distress remain unclear, though some question group's spending under founder Cameron Sinclair.
lead_paragraph: Architecture for Humanity, a nonprofit design group specializing in socially conscious construction, has abruptly closed its San Francisco headquarters and plans to file for bankruptcy protection.

headline.main: A Leader in Socially Conscious Architecture Is Closing Amid Financial Woes
headline.print_headline: A Leader in Socially Conscious Architecture Is Closing Amid Financial Woes
